“¡Oralé! Unpacking the Impact of Spanish-Language Accents on Latino Identity in U.S. Political Mobilization (with Alejandro (Alex) Flores)

title: Alejandro Frydman
text:

Welcome! I am a PhD Candidate in the Department of Political Science Department of Political Science at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Additionally, I am a Graduate Fellow at the Global Diversity Lab.
I study American politics, with a primary focus on Latino political behavior. Broadly, I am interested in Latino identity as a pan-ethnic category and how diversity within the Latino community can shape how Latinos engage with politics. Additionally, I have work in survey methodology and local politics.
Before graduate school, I worked as a campaign pollster at Lake Research Partners and opposition researcher at [redacted]. I graduated with a B.A. in Political Science with a minor in Latin American Studies from Washington University in St. Louis.
In my free time, I love to cook, go to shows, and watch movies. If you happen to be curious about what I’m listening to or what movies I’ve recently watched here is my last.fm and Letterboxd
Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or would like to discuss potential projects.
